info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 31 at 3:56PM EST until February 03 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Michigan. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commutes on Wednesday and Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This will be a prolonged period of snow. It will start as rain late in the day on Tuesday, then change to snow during the early morning hours of Wednesday. Snowfall amounts are less certain in this area, compared to those near I-94, even so we still expect 6 to 12 inches between Wednesday morning and Thursday evening. It will turn very cold by Wednesday evening as temperatures fall into the teens. Wind chill may fall to near zero Wednesday night into Thursday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
